individual_metadata.synopsis: This Ox is a fiendish creature in an ox's body. The ox will show the player a horrific vision from its mind, and potentially go aggro on the player if the player demands answers from it. The ox could also give a gift if the player is evil, like it.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Act 2 (HAV) -Go to HAV region via debug book > select "after checkpoint" Walk to the stables or use recon command: teleport -28 30 160Then speak to the ox in the stable furthest from the blacksmith.Act 3 (WYR) -Go to WYR region via debug bookEither choose the "refugee camp" checkpoint or use recon command: teleport 40 51 -138 to go straight there (the ox barn is next to the big barn at the refugee camp)Then enter the ox barn and speak to the ox.

45.speaker: Phasm
45.text: My skin is tingling. What will happen next?
45.context: InternalNodeContext: Note: I've repurposed the siege state for thisNodeContext: grotesque excitement

53.speaker: Phasm
53.text: Those shades might come streaming in any moment now...
53.context: InternalNodeContext: Note: I've repurposed the siege state for thisNodeContext: long 'aaaaany' moment-- almost like he's looking forward to it.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I want to know what you are.

33.speaker: Phasm
33.text: I admire your ability to graciously suffer the frustration of your desires.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Hold out your hand to the ox.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Peer at the ox with interest. There's something in its eyes...

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *There's an invitation behind its great, brown eyes.*

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Reach out to pet the ox.

89.speaker: Phasm
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cow doesn't want to be touched and stamps hooves/ backs away, avoiding contact.

88.speaker: Phasm
88.text: My, my! The fates move in strange and scrumptious ways. I am delighted to see you again.

73.speaker: Phasm
73.text: After our little interlude at Last Light, I was worried you'd gone quite mad.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: It takes worse than a bit of gore to turn my gullet.

63.speaker: Phasm
63.text: And mine. Oh-ho! And mine. Though one thing I find quite distasteful is being kept outside our intended city.

139.speaker: Phasm
139.text: I'd quite like to get inside. But it's difficult to shuffle your way to the top of the queue when you're, well, as big as an ox.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Glad the road to the city treated you kindly.

158.speaker: Phasm
158.text: Did it? I'm not so sure. I'm not in the city yet, you see.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Oh, goody. The ox with murder on its mind.

132.speaker: Phasm
132.text: You proved yourself capable of the truth. Now here's another.

55.speaker: Phasm
55.text: I want to get into the city. Now. But it's hard to shuffle your way to the front of the queue when you're, well, as big as an ox.

34.speaker: Phasm
34.text: But what if I were smaller? More discreet? Maybe then a kind soul might bring me through, right in their little pocket?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Not until you tell me exactly what you are.

135.speaker: Phasm
135.text: I don't think you want to travel this road, my friend.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I assure you I do. Tell me what you really are, or I'll strike you down myself.

31.speaker: Phasm
31.text: All I wanted was a bit of hay, a good brushing, and a clean stall. The simple life. IS THAT SO MUCH TO ASK?!
31.context: NodeContext: Escalating to fury and prepping to transform into evil creature and fight player.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Fine. I'll help you. Let us leave it at that.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Then you go your way, and I'll go mine.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I suppose so. What form will you take?

6.speaker: Phasm
6.text: Oohoohoo! This day has ended so much better than it started.

7.speaker: Phasm
7.text: Now, you don't worry about me. I'll be a good, quiet little apple you can tuck into the corner of your pack, just until we're inside the city walls.

179.speaker: Phasm
179.text: Hail Cyric, I can't wait to get inside.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Charge, charge through the city streets with me, leaving virgin hearts as smear-stains.

54.speaker: Phasm
54.text: My friend, you make me look like the very picture of sanity.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Maybe some kind soul might. But not me.

153.speaker: Phasm
153.text: Pity. I would have looked upon you with mercy, if the time for such things ever came to pass.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Excellent, the mad offal. What cruel visions do you have for me?

109.speaker: Phasm
109.text: I am an ox. All I've got on my mind is grass... stables... and a steady cart to pull.
109.context: NodeContext: Evil behind its eyes. It's lying.

102.speaker: Phasm
102.text: And while I'm on the topic... I'd like to settle into my new home.

94.speaker: Phasm
94.text: You've changed your mind about helping me into the city, haven't you?!

125.speaker: Player
125.text: I want to know what you are.

144.speaker: Phasm
144.text: I assure you, you do not.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Ah c'mon, now you've piqued my curiosity...

113.speaker: Phasm
113.text: Come close. Your mind to mine.
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ox and player lean close, foreheads close but not touching.

4.context: CinematicNodeContext: | Show a spliced together horror clip of spooky and/or gross images - this will be handled by a bespoke movie)

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Your mind... the unwanted visions... we are much alike.

110.speaker: Phasm
110.text: A kindred spirit. But I only wish to be an ox. Do you understand?

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I don't care what you might be behind it all; you're an ox to me.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: And I don't want to be a homicidal maniac, but we can't always get what we want.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: Pathetic! Do not conceal your exalted brutality!

58.speaker: Phasm
58.text: Brutality? Don't be silly. I like grass; I like my harness; I like the warmth of the stable.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Acquaint the cow with the depths of your depravity.

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *You deliver the ox a death by a thousand cuts, trying to taunt it into revealing its old form with every slice.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *It chooses to die docile in animal form. Only after its eyes fade does it become the monster it once was.*
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dead cow body is in front of you, blips to turn into the dead monster when gameplay resumes

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *You deliver the ox a death by a thousand cuts, trying to taunt it into revealing its old form with every slice.*

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *It chooses to die docile in animal form. Only after its eyes fade does it become the monster it once was.*
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dead cow body is in front of you, blips to turn into the dead monster when gameplay resumes

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Refuse to tear the creature apart, though you yearn to.

91.speaker: Phasm
91.text: You believe in your own doom; I believe in the life I can make for myself.

156.speaker: Phasm
156.text: You believe in your own doom; I believe in the life I can make for myself.

8.speaker: Phasm
8.text: Which begs the question... would you be willing to help me achieve me one and greatest goal?

81.speaker: Player
81.text: It may not be today, it may not be tomorrow, but you will lose control eventually.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Coward. You aren't worth my time.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You're trying to run from violent thoughts, too, aren't you?

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Those are the least bovine thoughts I've ever seen. What are you really?

29.speaker: Phasm
29.text: Keep quiet, and you won't have to find out.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Whatever you are, you're coming out of hiding. Now.

59.speaker: Phasm
59.text: All I wanted was a bit of hay, a good brushing, and a clean stall. The simple life. IS THAT SO MUCH TO ASK?!
59.context: NodeContext: Escalating to fury and prepping to transform into evil creature and fight player.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Your secret - whatever it is - is safe with me.

164.speaker: Phasm
164.text: Though... perhaps your better nature would extend a little further, for little old me.

95.speaker: Phasm
95.text: You're so very welcome. Now - you must have better things to do than hang around in a stable, surely?

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I could ask you the same question. What are you really?

66.speaker: Phasm
66.text: Leave it alone, while you still have the chance.

21.speaker: Phasm
21.text: I hate to be rude, but this stall is taken. I fear you won't like what happens if you don't leave now.
21.context: NodeContext: Through gritted teeth, wanting the player to leave.

121.speaker: Phasm
121.text: Actually - before we part ways - I wonder if I could appeal to you for a little favour.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: I'll trade you your secret for one of mine.

20.speaker: Phasm
20.text: I'm not a busybody. You ought to use me as an example, or you might get yourself in trouble.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: How does an ox like yourself have such horrifying thoughts?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: That was wonderful! A little messy, but wonderful.

141.speaker: Phasm
141.text: Here. A little token between friends - for your discretion.
141.context: InternalNodeContext: Gives reward to player - same as player would get for fighting ox.

61.speaker: Phasm
61.text: Your kindness gives me the courage to ask for a favour...

69.speaker: Phasm
69.text: I need to get into the city. But it's hard to shuffle your way to the front of the queue when you're, well, big as an ox.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You're the ox I met back in the grove. You were very hungry then; I saved you all, and now you have food.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: You're a rare breed. An authentic Red-Backed River Ox. I thought you'd be more discerning...

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I remember you from the druid's grove. Are you ready to reveal your secrets yet?

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You've said that twice now. I demand an explanation.
